intro: [WRONG START] Elaeidendron obtusum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed elaeodendron, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes plants known for their toxic properties and medicinal uses. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically narrow and elliptical in shape. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by small, red berries. The plant is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
